projectPurpose: To provide a high-performance, embeddable, and extensible SQL query engine for building data processing systems and applications.
mainFeatures: Native support for Parquet, CSV, JSON, Avro, and Object Storage (S3, GCS)
Extensible architecture with custom functions, sources, and operators
Leverages Apache Arrow for in-memory processing

alternatives.name: Apache Spark
mainFeatures: Unified engine for batch and stream processing
Spark SQL for SQL queries and DataFrames

alternatives.name: Trino
mainFeatures: Federated queries across multiple data sources

alternatives.name: DuckDB
mainFeatures: Directly reads Parquet, CSV, JSON files

alternatives.name: PrestoDB
mainFeatures: Connects to various data sources (HDFS, S3, databases)

alternatives.name: Dremio
mainFeatures: SQL engine directly on data lake storage (Iceberg, Parquet)

marketPositioning: Apache DataFusion is positioned as a high-performance, embeddable, and extensible SQL query engine written in Rust and deeply integrated with Apache Arrow. Unlike full database systems or distributed processing frameworks, DataFusion serves as a foundational library for developers to build custom data processing systems and applications. Its focus on embeddability, performance from Rust, and interoperability via Arrow distinguishes it from more monolithic or system-level alternatives. It targets developers who need a powerful query execution core within their own applications.
